alert.note: Alert for Bertie; Camden; Chowan; Eastern Currituck; Pasquotank; Perquimans; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 17 at 4:28AM EST until December 18 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast North Carolina, including the following areas, Bertie, Camden, Chowan, Eastern Currituck, Gates, Hertford, Northampton, Pasquotank, Perquimans and Western Currituck and Virginia, including the following areas, Brunswick, Chesapeake, Dinwiddie, Greensville, Hampton/Poquoson, Isle of Wight, Newport News, Norfolk/Portsmouth, Prince George, Southampton, Suffolk, Surry, Sussex and Virginia Beach. * WHEN...From 1 PM EST this afternoon through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A strong area of low pressure tracks north near the coast today into early Monday bringing moderate to heavy rain into the area from late this afternoon into tonight. Widespread two to three inches of rain is expected. Localized amounts up to four inches are possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Bertie; Camden; Chowan; Eastern Currituck; Pasquotank; Perquimans; Western Currituck
